summary: A letter from Fordham Law Professor Bruce A. Green to Judge Richard M. Berman clarifying that Green was not counsel in any Epstein-related case, but had served as an expert witness in a defamation case involving Alan Dershowitz. The letter addresses a misunderstanding from a prior court hearing regarding Green's role and his co-authorship of a New York Law Journal article.

keyFacts: Bruce A. Green clarifies he was never counsel to Jeffrey Epstein, his estate, or anyone in an Epstein-related case.
Green served as an expert witness (via declaration) in support of Alan Dershowitz's motion to disqualify David Boies in a defamation case (v. Dershowitz).
Judge Richard M. Berman and attorney David Boies had publicly suggested Green might be counsel in an Epstein-related case during an August 27, 2019 hearing.
The defamation case (v. Dershowitz) is described as 'Epstein-related' and was pending in the SDNY as of this letter.
Green's expert witness work concluded in June 2019 and did not involve representation or advocacy on behalf of Dershowitz.
